Functions

00301_GP_workspace_CryptoSession
[Limitations]

Involved Components and their required Functionality More...

Functions

 TestCase_GC00001_digest ()
 TestCase_GC00002_sign ()
 TestCase_GC00003_sym ()
 TestCase_GC00004_asym ()
 TestCase_GC00010_open_all ()

Detailed Description

Involved Components and their required Functionality

  1. ClientLib
    1. Can connect to daemon
    2. Can reserve memory for connection
  2. McDriverDaemon
    1. Daemon running
    2. Daemon socket accessible by TLC
    3. mcOpenDevice()
  3. Trusted Application TlTestIntegrationTest
    1. 1 Trusted Application copied to Android on Test device in registrymcRegistry as e48c207763fa5320b5edb45eb3eecb16.tabin

Meaning of this test group
Loading of GP trusted application which tries to open the maximun number of crypto session. Their are 4 different types of crypto session, their are 4 session allocated for each type:

  • digest
  • signature (which will share digest or cipher session pool)
  • cipher symmetric
  • cipher asymmetric

The test could also be used to load only one type of crypto session, with 4 test cases.

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC00001_digest (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
e48c207763fa5320b5edb45eb3eecb16
Pre Conditions:
setup() initializes the context
Focus:
Open GP TA session, which will open as many as possible crypto session for each crypto family (digest, sign, cipher sym and asym)
Test Steps:
Ensure that basic error on InvokeCommand is handled correctly. Note the internal test function will fail on allocation error, but this is ignored. The maximum number of crypto session is returned
Verification:
InvokeCommand has to return specified error code
Post Conditions:
teardown() closes session and finalizes the context
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
Limitations.00301_GP_workspace_CryptoSession.GC00001_digest

TestCase_GC00003_sym (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
e48c207763fa5320b5edb45eb3eecb16
Pre Conditions:
setup() initializes the context
Focus:
Open GP TA session, which will open as many as possible crypto session for each crypto family (digest, sign, cipher sym and asym)
Test Steps:
Ensure that basic error on InvokeCommand is handled correctly. Note the internal test function will fail on allocation error, but this is ignored. We use the same key for 3DES K1 and K2, thus 3DES is equivalent to simple DES The maximum number of crypto session is returned
Verification:
InvokeCommand has to return specified error code
Post Conditions:
teardown() closes session and finalizes the context
Manual Execution:
No
